FuncDef: The reset y1731 eth-test command deletes ETH-test configurations on a MEP that initiates an ETH-test instance.
CLIs: reset y1731 eth-test md <md-name> ma <ma-name> mep <mep-id>

ParaDef.Info:
Deletes ETH-test information in a specified MA.
The value is a string of 1 to 43 characters, and hyphens (-) or question marks (?) are not supported.

Deletes ETH-test information on a specified MEP.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 8191.

Deletes ETH-test configurations in a specified MD.
The value is a string of 1 to 43 characters, and hyphens (-) or question marks (?) are not supported.

Examples: <HUAWEI> reset y1731 eth-test md md1 ma ma1 mep 1
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Before starting an ETH-test instance, run the reset y1731 eth-test command to delete existing ETH-test information on a MEP that initiates an ETH-test instance. If an ETH-test instance is complete and its data is not needed, also run this command to delete the data.
Configuration Impact
Once the reset y1731 eth-test command deletes existing ETH-test information, the information cannot be restored. Exercise caution when using this command.
